English: Today you set the following goal(s) for improving your working climate and/or your relationships with your colleagues:
Deutsch: Heute haben Sie sich die folgenden beziehungsorienterten Ziele gesetzt:

text.English: To what extent did you act according to these goals today, on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 100 (completely)?
Were there other interactions you had with your colleagues today that you would like to tell me about?
Interesting, please tell me more about what you have been up to today.
text.Deutsch: Interessant, sagen Sie mir was Sie heute gemacht haben.

text.English: Overall, how did your social interactions today impact the work atmosphere of your team?
How do you feel about that, ${FIRST_NAME}? Please select any or all emotions you are experiencing at least a little bit.
text.Deutsch: Wie fühlen Sie sich darüber, ${FIRST_NAME}? Wählen Sie einige oder alle Emotionen, die Sie sogar ein bisschen verspüren.

English: Let's dig a little deeper to better understand why you feel the way you do and what you can learn from this experience.
Deutsch: Lass uns noch tiefer eingehen, um besser zu verstehen, warum Sie sich so fühlen und was Sie daraus lernen können.

English: Let's dig a little deeper to better understand why you feel the way you do and what you can learn from this experience.
Deutsch: Lass uns noch tiefer eingehen, um besser zu verstehen, warum Sie sich so fühlen und was Sie daraus lernen können.

text.English: Setting aside the outcomes and content of your goals to improve your workplace relationships/atmosphere for a moment, how satisfied are you with the way in which you pursued those goals today?
text.Deutsch: Abgesehen von den Ergebnissen und dem Inhalt Ihrer Ziele, wie zufrieden sind Sie mit der Arbeitsweise, mit der Sie heute auf Ihre Ziele hingearbeitet haben?

text.English: Now, setting aside how you pursued your goals and what the outcomes were, how relevant were these goals to the improvement of your workplace relationships/atmosphere?
text.Deutsch: Also, abgesehen davon, wie Sie Ihren Zielen nachgegangen sind, wie zufrieden sind Sie mit der Entscheidung dazu, an welchen Zielen Sie heute arbeiten?

English: That's okay, you can still improve!

text.English:
Let's take a step back and find out where these goals came from.

Please describe the thought process that led you to select the goals set for today.
text.Deutsch: Beschreiben Sie die Denkweise, die Sie dazu geführt haben, sich die Ziele zu setzen, die Sie heute gewählt haben.

Deutsch: Danke, dass Sie das mit mir mitteilen.

text.English: How effective do you think this process is in generating excellent daily goals that help improve your team's work atmosphere?
text.Deutsch: Wie effektiv finden Sie diesen Prozess, um gute Tagesziele zu erreichen, die den größeren Zielen Ihrer Projekte, Ihres Teams, und Ihrer Organisation entsprechen?

English: That's unfortunate, but good that you can acknowledge the shortcomings.
Deutsch: Schade. Gut, dass Sie die Fehler zugestehen können.

text.English: Based on that, do you think your goal-setting process could be improved?
text.Deutsch: Basierend darauf glauben Sie, dass Ihre Zielsetzungsprozedur noch zu verbessern ist?

then.English: We're done with relationship goals for today.

English: Congratulations on choosing to learn and improve!
Deutsch: Gratulation, dass Sie Lernen und Verbesserung gewählt haben!

text.English: What would you like to improve in your goal-setting process?
text.Deutsch: Was möchten Sie an Ihrer Zielsetzungsprozedur verbessern?

text.English: What is one small, concrete change you could make tomorrow to improve your goal-setting regarding workplace relationships/atmosphere?
text.Deutsch: Nennen Sie eine konkrete Änderung, die Ihre Zielsetzung morgen verbessern könnte.

text.English: Would you like me to remind you of this plan the next time you set a goal to improve the working atmosphere of your team or your relationships with your colleagues?
text.Deutsch: Möchten Sie, dass ich Sie morgen früh an diesen Plan erinnere?

text.English: Setting aside the outcomes and content of your goals to improve your workplace relationships/atmosphere for a moment, how satisfied are with the way in which you pursued your goals today compared to the last time you set relationship goals?
Compared to your most recent relationship goals, how relevant were the goals you pursued today to improving your workplace relationships/atmosphere?

Let's take a step back and see where these goals came from.

Did you change your approach to setting goals for improving your working climate since the last time we talked about it?

What did you change? Please select one or more of the following options. (1) I took a more deliberate/reflective approach to goal setting this time. (2) I took a more intuitive approach. (3) This time, I thought about my goals more concretely than last time and/or made a more detailed plan for how and/or when to achieve them. (4) This time, I explicitly thought about the main problems/challenges with our working atmosphere and how they can be addressed. (5) This time, I asked myself what I could do to make my colleagues feel safe in expressing disagreement and negative emotions. (6) This time, I asked myself what I could do to make my colleagues feel valued and appreciated for their unique perspectives. (7) This time, I asked myself what we could change to include more people in my team's activities and decisions. (8) This time, I thought about whether anyone on my team might sometimes feel that they don't belong and what I could do to help them. (9) This time, I thought about everyone on my team and not just the people I like the most. (10) Other (I want to type my own answer)

inputPrompt.English: Select one or more of the above numbered statements that you agree with. Remember to click Done after you are finished selecting.

English: Good that you noticed the differences in your strategy!

text.English: You mentioned that you would like to type in your own answer. What other change did you make in your approach to goal-setting for relationships since the last time?

English: Good that you noticed the differences in your strategy!

text.English: Which of the changes might have been a major reason why your goals were more relevant in improving workplace relationships/atmosphere this time?
Which of the changes might have been a major reason why your goals were less relevant in improving workplace relationships/atmosphere this time?
Why do you think your goals did not increase or decrease in relevance despite the changes?
Do you think you could adjust your approach to goal setting for improving workplace relationships/atmosphere even further?

English: Alright, sounds like you think your current strategy is working really well for you.

text.English: Interesting! Tell me more! Do you already have concrete ideas for things you want to try?

English: YES, I already know what I want to do
NO, I am not sure yet, do you have any suggestions?

text.English: Ok, here are some suggestions for changes you can make to your goal-setting. Feel free to use them as inspiration or enter another idea you have thought about. * Think more concretely about what you personally want to do: when and with whom. * Think about the main problems/challenges with our working atmosphere and how they can be addressed. * Ask what you can do to make your colleagues feel safe to express disagreement and negative emotions. * Ask what you can do to make your colleagues feel valued and appreciated for their unique perspectives. * Ask what you can change to help your colleagues feel included in your team's activities and decisions. * Ask whether anyone on your team might sometimes feel that they don't belong and what you could do to help them feel more included.

English: Okay, we're done with goal reflections for today
Deutsch: OK, das war es für heute.

English: Good job! You have reached the end of the second and final stage!
We will now start another round of questionnaires.
Deutsch: Glückwunsch, dass Sie das Ende dieser letzten Phase erreicht haben!
Jetzt haben wir noch eine Runde Umfragen.

English: Good job! You have reached the end of the first stage!
We will now start another round of questionnaires.
Deutsch: Glückwunsch, dass Sie das Ende dieser letzten Phase erreicht haben!
Jetzt haben wir noch eine Runde Umfragen.

English: Great job reflecting today! Thank you for such insightful answers. See you tomorrow!
Deutsch: Sie haben heute gut reflektiert! Danke für Ihre einsichtsvollen Antworten. Bis morgen!

English: Great job reflecting today! Thank you for such insightful answers. Have a good weekend, and see you on Monday!
Deutsch: Sie haben heute gut reflektiert! Danke für Ihre einsichtsvollen Antworten. Schönes Wochenende und Bis Montag!

text.English: Would you also like to reflect on your work-related goals today?
text.Deutsch: Möchten Sie heute Ihren Fortschritt in Bezug auf Ihre arbeitsbezogenen Ziele auch mitteilen?

English: Today, you set the following work-related goals:
Deutsch: Heute haben Sie sich die folgenden arbeitsbezogenen Ziele gesetzt:

text.English: Did you make progress toward your goals today? Rate it on a scale of 0 (no progress whatsoever) to 100 (everything complete). If you went above and beyond what you had planned, you can also enter a number above 100.
text.Deutsch: Wie viel Fortschritt haben Sie heute ihrer Ziele entgegen gemacht? Antworten Sie auf einer Skala von 0 (überhaupt kein Fortschritt) bis 100 (alles erledigt)? Wenn Sie über Ihre heutigen Pläne hinausgegangen sind, können Sie eine Zahl über 100 eingeben.

text.English: Were there any other major things you worked on today that you would like to tell me about?
text.Deutsch: Haben Sie heute an sonst etwas Wichtigem gearbeitet, die Sie mir berichten wollen?

text.English: Interesting, please tell me more about what you have been up to today.
text.Deutsch: Interessant, sagen Sie mir was Sie heute gemacht haben.

text.English: Select the word that you feel best completes this sentence: All in all, the amount of value I created for my projects, my team, and my organization today was ...
How do you feel about that, ${FIRST_NAME}? Please select any or all emotions you are experiencing at least a little bit.
text.Deutsch: Wie fühlen Sie sich darüber, ${FIRST_NAME}? Wählen Sie einige oder alle Emotionen, die Sie sogar ein bisschen verspüren.

English: Let's dig a little deeper to better understand why you feel that way and what you can learn from this experience.
Deutsch: Lass uns noch tiefer eingehen, um besser zu verstehen, warum Sie sich so fühlen und was Sie daraus lernen können.

English: Let's dig a little deeper to better understand why you feel that way and what you can learn from this experience.
Deutsch: Lass uns noch tiefer eingehen, um besser zu verstehen, warum Sie sich so fühlen und was Sie daraus lernen können.

text.English: Setting aside the outcomes and content of your goals for a moment, how satisfied are you with the way you pursued your goals today?
text.Deutsch: Abgesehen von den Ergebnissen und dem Inhalt Ihrer Ziele, wie zufrieden sind Sie mit der Arbeitsweise, mit der Sie heute auf Ihre Ziele hingearbeitet haben?

text.English: How relevant were the goals you pursued today to the long-term goals of your project(s), your team, and your organization?
text.Deutsch: Wie relevant waren Ihre heutigen Ziele für die Langzeitziel von Ihrem Projekt, Team, und Ihrer Organisation?

English: That's unfortunate. Don't worry, there's always room for improvement!
Let's now take a step back and find out where those goals came from.
Deutsch: Jetzt nehmen wir einen Schritt zurück und denken wir darüber nach, woher diese Ziele hergekommen sind.

English: Let's now take a step back and find out where those goals came from.
Deutsch: Jetzt nehmen wir einen Schritt zurück und denken wir darüber nach, woher diese Ziele hergekommen sind.

English: Let's now take a step back and find out where those goals came from.
Deutsch: Jetzt nehmen wir einen Schritt zurück und denken wir darüber nach, woher diese Ziele hergekommen sind.

text.English: Please describe the thought process that led you to select the goals that you set for today.
text.Deutsch: Beschreiben Sie die Denkweise, die Sie dazu geführt haben, sich die Ziele zu setzen, die Sie heute gewählt haben.

Deutsch: Danke, dass Sie das mit mir mitteilen.

text.English: How effective do you think this process is at generating excellent daily goals that are well-aligned with the larger goals of your project(s), your team, and your organization?
text.Deutsch: Wie effektiv finden Sie diesen Prozess, um gute Tagesziele zu erreichen, die den größeren Zielen Ihrer Projekte, Ihres Teams, und Ihrer Organisation entsprechen?

English: That's unfortunate, but good that you can acknowledge the shortcomings.
Deutsch: Schade. Gut, dass Sie die Fehler zugestehen können.

text.English: Based on that, do you think your goal-setting process could be improved?
text.Deutsch: Basierend darauf glauben Sie, dass Ihre Zielsetzungsprozedur noch zu verbessern ist?

then.English: Okay, then that wraps up everything for today.
then.Deutsch: OK, dann war das es für heute.

English: Congratulations on choosing to learn and improve!
Deutsch: Gratulation, dass Sie Lernen und Verbesserung gewählt haben!

text.English: What would you like to improve in your goal-setting process?
text.Deutsch: Gratulation, dass Sie Lernen und Verbesserung gewählt haben. Was möchten Sie an Ihrer Zielsetzungsprozedur verbessern?

text.English: What is one small, concrete change that you could make the next time to improve on your goal-setting?
text.Deutsch: Nennen Sie eine konkrete Änderung, die Ihre Zielsetzung morgen verbessern könnte.

text.English: Would you like me to remind you of this plan the next time you are setting work-related goals?
text.Deutsch: Möchten Sie, dass ich Sie morgen früh an diesen Plan erinnere?

Deutsch: OK, das war es für heute.

text.English: Setting aside the outcomes and content of your goals for a moment, how satisfied are with the way in which you pursued your goals today compared to the last time you set work-related goals?
Compared to your most recent work-related goals, how relevant were the goals you pursued today to the long-term goals of your project(s), your team, and your organization?

Let's take a step back and see where these goals came from.

Did you change your approach to goal setting since the last time we talked about it?

What did you change? Please select one or more of the following options. (1) I took a more deliberate/reflective approach to goal setting this time. (2) I took a more intuitive approach. (3) This time, I thought more about the big picture. (4) When setting my goals, I reacted less to external requests and circumstances than last time. (5) I set my goals earlier than last time. (6) This time, I thought about my goals more concretely than last time and/or made a more detailed plan for how and/or when to achieve them. (7) This time, I aimed higher/lower than last time. (8) Other (I want to type my own answer)

inputPrompt.English: Select one or more of the above numbered statements that you agree with. Remember to click Done after you are finished selecting.

English: Good that you noticed the differences in your strategy!

text.English: You mentioned that you would like to type in your own answer. What other change did you make in your approach to goal-setting since the last time?

English: Good that you noticed the differences in your strategy!

text.English: Which of the changes might have been a major reason why your goals were more relevant to the long-term goals of your project(s) this time?
Which of the changes might have been a major reason why your goals were less relevant to the long-term goals of your project(s) this time?
Why do you think your goals did not increase or decrease in relevance despite these changes?
Do you think it is possible that your approach to goal setting could be improved further?

English: Okay, sounds like you think your current strategy is working really well for you.

text.English: Interesting! Tell me more! Do you already have concrete ideas for things you want to try?

English: YES, I already know what I want to do
NO, I am not sure yet, do you have any suggestions?

text.English: Ok, here are some suggestions for changes you can make to your goal-setting. Feel free to use them as inspiration or enter another idea you have thought about. * Set explicit goals for yourself or your team. * Take a more deliberate/reflective approach to goal setting this time. * Think more about the big picture. * Proactively think about what might be most beneficial in the long run instead of reacting to external requests and events. * Set your goals ahead of time. * Think about your goals more concretely and/or make a more detailed plan for how and/or when to achieve them. * Try to be more realistic * Aim higher
